headline.main: Employers Focus on Weight As Workplace Health Issue

docs.abstract: More and more businesses are promoting exercise and nutrition regimens among employees in effort to reduce the health risk of being overweight; employers bear a good part of what obesity costs the US in terms of doctors visits, lost productivity, absenteeism and hospital stays, $99.2 billion in 1995; photo; graph (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: With health costs spiraling again, employers are taking a closer look at their workers' waistlines, tackling a complicated and sensitive issue that affects not just medical costs but morale and productivity. While companies typically tread softly to avoid giving offense or violating discrimination laws, many are trying harder to promote exercise and nutrition regimens to reduce the health risks of being overweight.
